medical_history.chief_complaint: Vomiting and epigastric/RUQ abdominal pain for 2 weeks
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 weeks ago with vomiting of clear or yellow liquid occurring 1-2 times per day. Initially, vomiting improved but then worsened, leading to an ED visit. Associated symptoms include chills and sweats. The patient has lost 20lbs in 2 weeks due to poor appetite and nausea.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Anxiety, headaches, mental retardation, mild hypertension, strabismus, tremor, weight loss, allergic rhinitis
medical_history.family_history: Two aunts had gallstone disease s/p cholecystectomy
